9#ifndef V8_WASM_INLINING_TREE_H_
10#define V8_WASM_INLINING_TREE_H_
11
12#include <cstdint>
13#include <queue>
14#include <vector>
15
16#include "src/utils/utils.h"
17#include "src/wasm/compilation-environment.h"
18#include "src/wasm/wasm-module.h"
19#include "src/zone/zone-containers.h"
20
21namespace v8::internal::wasm {
22
23// Represents a tree of inlining decisions.
24// A node in the tree represents a function frame, and `function_calls_`
25// represent all direct/call_ref/call_indirect function calls in this frame.
26// Each element of `function_calls_` is itself a `Vector` of `InliningTree`s,
27// corresponding to the different speculative candidates for a
28// call_ref/call_indirect; for a direct call, it has a single element.
29// If a transitive element of `function_calls_` has its `is_inlined_` field set,
30// it should be inlined into the caller.
31// We have this additional datastructure for Turboshaft, since nodes in the
32// Turboshaft IR aren't as easily expanded incrementally, so all the inlining
33// decisions are already done before graph building on this abstracted form of
34// the code.
35class InliningTree : public ZoneObject {
36 public:
37 using CasesPerCallSite = base::Vector<InliningTree*>;
38
39 InliningTree(Zone* zone, const WasmModule* module, uint32_t function_index,
40 int call_count, int wire_byte_size,
41 uint32_t topmost_caller_index, uint32_t caller_index,
42 int feedback_slot, int the_case, uint32_t depth)
43 : zone_(zone),
44 module_(module),
45 function_index_(function_index),
46 call_count_(call_count),
47 wire_byte_size_(wire_byte_size),
48 depth_(depth),
49 topmost_caller_index_(topmost_caller_index),
50 caller_index_(caller_index),
51 feedback_slot_(feedback_slot),
52 case_(the_case) {}
53
54 int64_t score() const {
55 // Note that the zero-point is arbitrary. Functions with negative score
56 // can still get inlined.
57 constexpr int count_factor = 2;
58 constexpr int size_factor = 3;
59 return int64_t{call_count_} * count_factor -
60 int64_t{wire_byte_size_} * size_factor;
61 }
62
63 static constexpr int kMaxInlinedCount = 60;
64
65 // Recursively expand the tree by expanding this node and children nodes etc.
66 // Nodes are prioritized by their `score`. Expansion continues until
67 // `kMaxInlinedCount` nodes are expanded or `budget` (in wire-bytes size) is
68 // depleted.
69 void FullyExpand(const size_t initial_graph_size);
70 base::Vector<CasesPerCallSite> function_calls() { return function_calls_; }
71 bool feedback_found() { return feedback_found_; }
72 bool is_inlined() { return is_inlined_; }
73 uint32_t function_index() { return function_index_; }
74
75 private:
76 // Mark this function call as inline and initialize `function_calls_` based
77 // on the `module_->type_feedback`.
78 void Inline();
79 bool SmallEnoughToInline(size_t initial_graph_size,
80 size_t inlined_wire_byte_count);
81
82 // TODO(14108): Do not store these in every tree node.
83 Zone* zone_;
84 const WasmModule* module_;
85
86 uint32_t function_index_;
87 int call_count_;
88 int wire_byte_size_;
89 bool is_inlined_ = false;
90 bool feedback_found_ = false;
91
92 base::Vector<CasesPerCallSite> function_calls_{};
93
94 // Limit the nesting depth of inlining. Inlining decisions are based on call
95 // counts. A small function with high call counts that is called recursively
96 // would be inlined until all budget is used.
97 // TODO(14108): This still might not lead to ideal results. Other options
98 // could be explored like penalizing nested inlinees.
99 static constexpr uint32_t kMaxInliningNestingDepth = 7;
100 uint32_t depth_;
101
102 // For tracing.
103 // TODO(14108): Do not store all of these in every tree node.
104 uint32_t topmost_caller_index_;
105 uint32_t caller_index_;
106 int feedback_slot_;
107 int case_;
108};
109
110void InliningTree::Inline() {
111 is_inlined_ = true;
112 auto feedback =
113 module_->type_feedback.feedback_for_function.find(function_index_);
114 if (feedback != module_->type_feedback.feedback_for_function.end() &&
115 feedback->second.feedback_vector.size() ==
116 feedback->second.call_targets.size()) {
117 std::vector<CallSiteFeedback>& type_feedback =
118 feedback->second.feedback_vector;
119 feedback_found_ = true;
120 function_calls_ =
121 zone_->AllocateVector<CasesPerCallSite>(type_feedback.size());
122 for (size_t i = 0; i < type_feedback.size(); i++) {
123 function_calls_[i] =
124 zone_->AllocateVector<InliningTree*>(type_feedback[i].num_cases());
125 for (int the_case = 0; the_case < type_feedback[i].num_cases();
126 the_case++) {
127 uint32_t callee_index = type_feedback[i].function_index(the_case);
128 // TODO(jkummerow): Experiment with propagating relative call counts
129 // into the nested InliningTree, and weighting scores there accordingly.
130 function_calls_[i][the_case] = zone_->New<InliningTree>(
131 zone_, module_, callee_index, type_feedback[i].call_count(the_case),
132 module_->functions[callee_index].code.length(),
133 topmost_caller_index_, function_index_, static_cast<int>(i),
134 the_case, depth_ + 1);
135 }
136 }
137 }
138}
139
140struct TreeNodeOrdering {
141 bool operator()(InliningTree* t1, InliningTree* t2) {
142 // Prefer callees with a higher score, and if the scores are equal,
143 // those with a lower function index (to make the queue ordering strict).
144 return std::make_pair(t1->score(), t2->function_index()) <
145 std::make_pair(t2->score(), t1->function_index());
146 }
147};
148
149void InliningTree::FullyExpand(const size_t initial_graph_size) {
150 DCHECK_EQ(this->function_index_, this->topmost_caller_index_);
151 size_t inlined_wire_byte_count = 0;
152 std::priority_queue<InliningTree*, std::vector<InliningTree*>,
153 TreeNodeOrdering>
154 queue;
155 queue.push(this);
156 int inlined_count = 0;
157 base::SharedMutexGuard<base::kShared> mutex_guard(
158 &module_->type_feedback.mutex);
159 while (!queue.empty() && inlined_count < kMaxInlinedCount) {
160 InliningTree* top = queue.top();
161 if (v8_flags.trace_wasm_inlining) {
162 if (top != this) {
163 PrintF(
164 "[function %d: in function %d, considering call #%d, case #%d, to "
165 "function %d... ",
166 top->topmost_caller_index_, top->caller_index_, top->feedback_slot_,
167 static_cast<int>(top->case_),
168 static_cast<int>(top->function_index_));
169 } else {
170 PrintF("[function %d: expanding topmost caller... ",
171 top->topmost_caller_index_);
172 }
173 }
174 queue.pop();
175 if (top->function_index_ < module_->num_imported_functions) {
176 if (v8_flags.trace_wasm_inlining && top != this) {
177 PrintF("imported function]\n");
178 }
179 continue;
180 }
181
182 int min_count_for_inlining = v8_flags.wasm_inlining_ignore_call_counts
183 ? 0
184 : top->wire_byte_size_ / 2;
185 if (top != this && top->wire_byte_size_ >= 12 &&
186 (top->call_count_ < min_count_for_inlining)) {
187 if (v8_flags.trace_wasm_inlining) {
188 PrintF("not called often enough]\n");
189 }
190 continue;
191 }
192
193 if (!top->SmallEnoughToInline(initial_graph_size,
194 inlined_wire_byte_count)) {
195 if (v8_flags.trace_wasm_inlining && top != this) {
196 PrintF("not enough inlining budget]\n");
197 }
198 continue;
199 }
200 if (v8_flags.trace_wasm_inlining && top != this) {
201 PrintF("decided to inline! ");
202 }
203 top->Inline();
204 inlined_count++;
205 inlined_wire_byte_count += top->wire_byte_size_;
206 if (top->feedback_found()) {
207 if (top->depth_ < kMaxInliningNestingDepth) {
208 if (v8_flags.trace_wasm_inlining) PrintF("queueing callees]\n");
209 for (CasesPerCallSite cases : top->function_calls_) {
210 for (InliningTree* call : cases) {
211 if (call != nullptr) {
212 queue.push(call);
213 }
214 }
215 }
216 } else if (v8_flags.trace_wasm_inlining) {
217 PrintF("max inlining depth reached]\n");
218 }
219 } else {
220 if (v8_flags.trace_wasm_inlining) PrintF("feedback not found]\n");
221 }
222 }
223 if (v8_flags.trace_wasm_inlining && !queue.empty()) {
224 PrintF("[function %d: too many inlining candidates, stopping...]\n",
225 this->topmost_caller_index_);
226 }
227}
228
229// Returns true if there is still enough budget left to inline the current
230// candidate given the initial graph size and the already inlined wire bytes.
231// TODO(mliedtke): The upper_budget calculation only depends on the module, not
232// on the callsite / callee. Consider moving this to a more central place and
233// propagating the information along the inlining tree.
234bool InliningTree::SmallEnoughToInline(size_t initial_graph_size,
235 size_t inlined_wire_byte_count) {
236 if (wire_byte_size_ > static_cast<int>(v8_flags.wasm_inlining_max_size)) {
237 return false;
238 }
239 // For tiny functions, let's be a bit more generous.
240 if (wire_byte_size_ < 12) {
241 if (inlined_wire_byte_count > 100) {
242 inlined_wire_byte_count -= 100;
243 } else {
244 inlined_wire_byte_count = 0;
245 }
246 }
247 // For small-ish functions, the inlining budget is defined by the larger of
248 // 1) the wasm_inlining_budget and
249 // 2) the wasm_inlining_factor * initial_graph_size.
250 // Inlining a little bit should always be fine even for tiny functions (1),
251 // otherwise (2) makes sure that the budget scales in relation with the
252 // original function size to limit the compile time regressions caused by
253 // inlining.
254 size_t budget_small_function =
255 std::max<size_t>(v8_flags.wasm_inlining_min_budget,
256 v8_flags.wasm_inlining_factor * initial_graph_size);
257 // For large-ish functions, the inlining budget is mainly defined by the
258 // wasm_inlining_budget.
259 size_t upper_budget = v8_flags.wasm_inlining_budget;
260 double small_function_percentage =
261 module_->num_small_functions * 100.0 / module_->num_declared_functions;
262 if (small_function_percentage < 50) {
263 // If there are few small functions, it indicates that the toolchain already
264 // performed significant inlining. Reduce the budget significantly as
265 // inlining has a diminishing ROI.
266
267 // We also apply a linear progression of the budget in the interval [25, 50]
268 // for the small_function_percentage. This progression is just added to
269 // prevent performance cliffs (e.g. when just performing a sharp cutoff at
270 // the 50% point) and not based on actual data.
271 double smallishness = std::max(25.0, small_function_percentage) - 25.0;
272 size_t lower_budget = upper_budget / 10;
273 double step = (upper_budget - lower_budget) / 25.0;
274 upper_budget = lower_budget + smallishness * step;
275 }
276 // Independent of the wasm_inlining_budget, for large functions we should
277 // still allow some inlining which is why 10% of the graph size is the minimal
278 // budget even for large functions larger than the upper_budget.
279 size_t budget_large_function =
280 std::max<size_t>(upper_budget, initial_graph_size * 1.1);
281 size_t total_size = initial_graph_size + inlined_wire_byte_count +
282 static_cast<size_t>(wire_byte_size_);
283 return total_size <
284 std::min<size_t>(budget_small_function, budget_large_function);
285}
286
287} // namespace v8::internal::wasm
288
289#endif // V8_WASM_INLINING_TREE_H_
